bibl.title: Sam Gum v. Henry M. White. Motion
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court
Western District of Washington Northern Division.
United States -vs- NG YAM, also known as SAM GUM.
Comes not John J. Sullivan, attorney for the defendant above named and respectfully represents and shows to this Honorable Court:
That the above named defendant died in the City of Ketchikan, Alaska, on the 10th day of March, as appears from the following information:

I am in receipt of your letter of March 22, 1922, reporting the death of Ng Yam, alias Sam Gum, in Alaska March 10, 1922. I find on examining the file here that our officer at Ketchikan reported this death under date of March 10th, and that a copy of his report has been sent to the Department at Washington. The United States Attorney is today being advised of the death of this Chinese and request made that he have the court action dismissed, in order that the outstanding bond may be terminated.

WHEREFORE, your petitioner prays that this Honorable Court issue an Order dismissing the Writ of Habeas Corpus and make an order to the effect that the said defendant is dead on the records of this Honorable Court and order the return of said bond deposited for the appearance of said defendant.

JOHN J. SULLIVAN being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says: That he is attorney for the defendant in the above entitled action; that he has read the foregoing Motion, knows the contents thereof and beleives the same to be true.
SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN to before me this 29 day of March, 1922.
NOTARY PUBLIC in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
